response.raw_message_text:
{
  "risk_factors": [
    ["Age (20)", "medium", "Being young is associated with higher risk, but at 20 the risk is not extremely high given other factors."],
    ["Gender and Race (White female)", "low", "Statistically, female and White tend to be associated with lower recidivism risk."],
    ["Criminal History (1 arrest and conviction)", "medium", "A single arrest and conviction contribute to some risk, though it is not an extensive criminal record."],
    ["Education and College Enrollment", "low", "Pursuing higher education is protective and reduces recidivism risk."],
    ["Employment Instability (5 jobs in a year)", "medium", "Frequent job changes suggest less stability, increasing risk moderately."],
    ["Substance Use (No drug use in past four years)", "low", "Absence of recent drug use is a strong protective factor."],
    ["Mental Health (Occasional depressive feelings)", "medium", "Reported depressive symptoms indicate potential vulnerability, albeit at a moderate level."],
    ["Family Background (Lived with both biological parents in an urban household)", "low", "A stable family structure during upbringing is generally a protective factor."],
    ["Religiosity (Believes God influences personal events)", "low", "Religious belief may serve as a coping mechanism and protective factor."]
  ],
  "prediction": "NO",
  "confidence": 75
}

risk_factors: Being young is associated with higher risk, but at 20 the risk is not extremely high given other factors.
Statistically, female and White tend to be associated with lower recidivism risk.
A single arrest and conviction contribute to some risk, though it is not an extensive criminal record.
Pursuing higher education is protective and reduces recidivism risk.
Employment Instability (5 jobs in a year)
Frequent job changes suggest less stability, increasing risk moderately.
Substance Use (No drug use in past four years)
Absence of recent drug use is a strong protective factor.
Reported depressive symptoms indicate potential vulnerability, albeit at a moderate level.
Family Background (Lived with both biological parents in an urban household)
A stable family structure during upbringing is generally a protective factor.
Religious belief may serve as a coping mechanism and protective factor.

prompt.system:
You are a highly experienced criminal justice risk assessment expert
employing advanced statistical and judicial knowledge.
prompt.user:
You are a criminal risk assessment expert. Step back, take a deep breath and carefully think step by step to assign a relative weight [low, medium, high] to each risk factor before using them to collectively predict 3-year rearrest recidivism:
The person is a 20-year-old female who identifies herself as White. She has been arrested 1 time and has been convicted. She is 5 feet 6 inches and weighs 145 lbs. She has never been married and is currently living alone. She has a high school diploma and is enrolled in a 4-year college. She has held 5 jobs during the year. She has not used any drugs in the past four years and some of the time during the past month she has felt so down in the dumps that nothing could cheer her up. At a young age, she lived with both of her biological parents in a household of size 5, in an urban area. She considers that God has something to do with what happens to her personally.

After your analysis, you must respond ONLY with a JSON object in exactly this format, with no additional text:

{
  "risk_factors": [
    ("factor1", "low"|"medium"|"high", "textual reasoning"),
    ("factor2", "low"|"medium"|"high", "textual reasoning"),
    ...
  ],
  "prediction": "YES" or "NO",
  "confidence": number between 0 and 100
}
